alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Fayette; Franklin; Pickaway; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 2:41PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, NORTHWESTERN FAIRFIELD, EAST CENTRAL FAYETTE, PICKAWAY AND NORTHWESTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM EDT... At 240 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near New Holland, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, nickel size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Lancaster, Grove City, Pickerington, Washington Court House, Circleville, Bexley, Canal Winchester, Groveport, Ashville, South Bloomfield, Williamsport, New Holland, Whitehall, Obetz, Commercial Point, Royalton, Lithopolis, Fox and Carroll. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 100 and 110. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 95 and 105, and between mile markers 107 and 109. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
